pli-tv-kd13:0.3: The chapter containing the collection of processes for the clearing of offenses entailing suspension
pli-tv-kd13:1.1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-kd13:1.1.2: At that time Venerable Udāyī had committed one unconcealed offense of intentional emission of semen.
pli-tv-kd13:1.1.3: He told the monks about this,
pli-tv-kd13:1.1.6: They told the Buddha and he said,
pli-tv-kd13:1.1.7: “Well then, the Sangha should give the monk Udāyī the trial period of six days for one unconcealed offense of intentional emission of semen.
pli-tv-kd13:1.2.1: And it should be given like this:
pli-tv-kd13:1.2.2.0: Trial periods for those with unconcealed offenses
pli-tv-kd13:1.2.2.1: “The monk Udāyī should approach the Sangha, put his upper robe over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the senior monks, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:
pli-tv-kd13:1.2.3: ‘Venerables, I have committed one unconcealed offense of intentional emission of semen.
pli-tv-kd13:1.2.4: I ask the Sangha for the trial period of six days for that offense.
pli-tv-kd13:1.2.5: I have committed one unconcealed offense of intentional emission of semen.
pli-tv-kd13:1.2.6: For the second time I ask the Sangha for the trial period of six days for that offense.
pli-tv-kd13:1.2.7: I have committed one unconcealed offense of intentional emission of semen.
pli-tv-kd13:1.2.8: For the third time I ask the Sangha for the trial period of six days for that offense.’
pli-tv-kd13:1.3.1: A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:
pli-tv-kd13:1.3.2: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-kd13:1.3.3: The monk Udāyī has committed one unconcealed offense of intentional emission of semen.
pli-tv-kd13:1.3.4: He is asking the Sangha for the trial period of six days for that offense.
pli-tv-kd13:1.3.5: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should give him the trial period of six days for that offense.
pli-tv-kd13:1.3.7: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-kd13:1.3.8: The monk Udāyī has committed one unconcealed offense of intentional emission of semen.
pli-tv-kd13:1.3.9: He is asking the Sangha for the trial period of six days for that offense.
pli-tv-kd13:1.3.10: The Sangha gives him the trial period of six days for that offense.
pli-tv-kd13:1.3.11: Any monk who approves of giving him the trial period of six days for that offense should remain silent.
pli-tv-kd13:1.3.12: Any monk who does not approve should speak up.
pli-tv-kd13:1.3.13: For the second time I speak on this matter.
pli-tv-kd13:1.3.14: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-kd13:1.3.15: The monk Udāyī has committed one unconcealed offense of intentional emission of semen.
pli-tv-kd13:1.3.16: He is asking the Sangha for the trial period of six days for that offense.
pli-tv-kd13:1.3.17: The Sangha gives him the trial period of six days for that offense.
pli-tv-kd13:1.3.18: Any monk who approves of giving him the trial period of six days for that offense should remain silent.
pli-tv-kd13:1.3.19: Any monk who does not approve should speak up.
pli-tv-kd13:1.3.20: For the third time I speak on this matter.
pli-tv-kd13:1.3.21: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-kd13:1.3.22: The monk Udāyī has committed one unconcealed offense of intentional emission of semen.
pli-tv-kd13:1.3.23: He is asking the Sangha for the trial period of six days for that offense.
pli-tv-kd13:1.3.24: The Sangha gives him the trial period of six days for that offense.
pli-tv-kd13:1.3.25: Any monk who approves of giving him the trial period of six days for that offense should remain silent.
pli-tv-kd13:1.3.26: Any monk who does not approve should speak up.
pli-tv-kd13:1.3.27: The Sangha has given the monk Udāyī the trial period of six days for one unconcealed offense of intentional emission of semen.
pli-tv-kd13:1.3.28: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”

pli-tv-kd13:20.1.0.2: Simultaneous probations according to the longest duration
pli-tv-kd13:20.1.1: At one time a monk had committed a number of offenses entailing suspension:
pli-tv-kd13:20.1.2: one concealed for one day, one for two days, one for three days, one for four days, one for five days, one for six days, one for seven days, one for eight days, one for nine days, and one for ten days.
pli-tv-kd13:20.1.3: He told the monks about this,
pli-tv-kd13:20.1.8: They told the Buddha and he said,
pli-tv-kd13:20.1.9: “Well then, the Sangha should give that monk simultaneous probation according to the longest duration, that is, for the offense that was concealed for ten days.
pli-tv-kd13:20.2.1: And it should be given like this:
pli-tv-kd13:20.2.2: That monk should approach the Sangha, put his upper robe over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the senior monks, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms,
pli-tv-kd13:20.2.4: ‘Venerables, I have committed a number of offenses entailing suspension:
pli-tv-kd13:20.2.7: I ask the Sangha for simultaneous probation according to the longest duration, that is, for the offense that was concealed for ten days.’

pli-tv-kd13:20.2.15: He is asking the Sangha for simultaneous probation according to the longest duration, that is, for the offense that was concealed for ten days.
pli-tv-kd13:20.2.16: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should give him that simultaneous probation.

pli-tv-kd13:20.2.24: Any monk who approves of giving him

pli-tv-kd13:22.1.1: At one time a monk had committed two offenses entailing suspension, both concealed for two months.
pli-tv-kd13:22.1.3: “I have committed two offenses entailing suspension, both concealed for two months.
pli-tv-kd13:22.1.4: I should ask the Sangha for probation for two months for one of those offenses.”
pli-tv-kd13:22.1.6: and the Sangha gave him that probation.
pli-tv-kd13:22.1.7: While he was on probation, he was conscience-stricken.
pli-tv-kd13:22.1.8: He considered what he had done,
pli-tv-kd13:22.1.15: and then thought, “I should ask the Sangha for probation for two months for the other offense too.”
pli-tv-kd13:22.2.1: He told the monks everything that had happened,
pli-tv-kd13:22.2.18: They told the Buddha and he said,
pli-tv-kd13:22.3.1: “Well then, the Sangha should give that monk probation for two months for that offense.
pli-tv-kd13:22.3.2: And it should be given like this:

pli-tv-kd13:27.1.1: At one time a monk on probation disrobed.
pli-tv-kd13:27.1.2: He then came back and asked the monks for full ordination.
pli-tv-kd13:27.1.3: They told the Buddha and he said,
pli-tv-kd13:27.1.4: “It may be that a monk on probation disrobes.
pli-tv-kd13:27.1.5: For one who has disrobed, the probation is suspended.
pli-tv-kd13:27.1.6: If he is given the full ordination again, he continues the previous probationary process right away.
pli-tv-kd13:27.1.7: The probation that was given is valid. The probation he has already undertaken is valid. The remainder is to be undertaken.
pli-tv-kd13:27.1.8: It may be that a monk on probation becomes a novice monk.
pli-tv-kd13:27.1.9: For a novice monk, the probation is suspended.
pli-tv-kd13:27.1.10: If he is given the full ordination again, he continues the previous probationary process right away.
pli-tv-kd13:27.1.11: The probation that was given is valid. The probation he has already undertaken is valid. The remainder is to be undertaken.
pli-tv-kd13:27.1.12: It may be that a monk on probation goes insane.
pli-tv-kd13:27.1.13: For one who is insane, the probation is suspended.
pli-tv-kd13:27.1.14: If he regains his sanity, he continues the previous probationary process right away.
pli-tv-kd13:27.1.15: The probation that was given is valid. The probation he has already undertaken is valid. The remainder is to be undertaken.
pli-tv-kd13:27.1.16: It may be that a monk on probation becomes deranged.
pli-tv-kd13:27.1.17: For one who is deranged, the probation is suspended.
pli-tv-kd13:27.1.18: If he regains his sanity, he continues the previous probationary process right away.
pli-tv-kd13:27.1.19: The probation that was given is valid. The probation he has already undertaken is valid. The remainder is to be undertaken.
pli-tv-kd13:27.1.20: It may be that a monk on probation is overwhelmed by pain.
pli-tv-kd13:27.1.21: For one who is overwhelmed by pain, the probation is suspended.
pli-tv-kd13:27.1.22: If he recovers, he continues the previous probationary process right away.
pli-tv-kd13:27.1.23: The probation that was given is valid. The probation he has already undertaken is valid. The remainder is to be undertaken.
pli-tv-kd13:27.1.24: It may be that a monk on probation is ejected for not recognizing an offense.
pli-tv-kd13:27.1.25: For one who is ejected, the probation is suspended.
pli-tv-kd13:27.1.26: If he is re-admitted, he continues the previous probationary process right away.
pli-tv-kd13:27.1.27: The probation that was given is valid. The probation he has already undertaken is valid. The remainder is to be undertaken.
pli-tv-kd13:27.1.28: It may be that a monk on probation is ejected for not making amends for an offense.
pli-tv-kd13:27.1.29: For one who is ejected, the probation is suspended.
pli-tv-kd13:27.1.30: If he is re-admitted, he continues the previous probationary process right away.
pli-tv-kd13:27.1.31: The probation that was given is valid. The probation he has already undertaken is valid. The remainder is to be undertaken.
pli-tv-kd13:27.1.32: It may be that a monk on probation is ejected for not giving up a bad view.
pli-tv-kd13:27.1.33: For one who is ejected, the probation is suspended.
pli-tv-kd13:27.1.34: If he is re-admitted, he continues the previous probationary process right away.
pli-tv-kd13:27.1.35: The probation that was given is valid. The probation he has already undertaken is valid. The remainder is to be undertaken.

pli-tv-kd13:28.1.1: “It may be that a monk on probation commits a number of offenses entailing suspension—specified and unconcealed.

pli-tv-kd13:35.1.1: “It may be that a monk has committed a number of offenses entailing suspension, both specified and unspecified, both of the same name and of various names, both of the same kind and of various kinds, both of the same sort and of various sorts.
pli-tv-kd13:35.1.2: He asks the Sangha for simultaneous probation for those offenses,
pli-tv-kd13:35.1.3: and the Sangha gives him that probation.
pli-tv-kd13:35.1.4: While on probation, he commits a number of offenses entailing suspension—specified and unconcealed.
pli-tv-kd13:35.1.5: He asks the Sangha to send him back to the beginning for those offenses,
pli-tv-kd13:35.1.6: and it does. The legal procedure is legitimate, irreversible, and fit to stand. And the Sangha gives him simultaneous probation legitimately.
pli-tv-kd13:35.1.7: It then gives him the trial period of six days illegitimately, and the rehabilitation illegitimately.
pli-tv-kd13:35.1.8: That monk isn’t purified from those offenses.
